p: The alarming situation reported by Djobel inhabitants is portrayed by the remote sensing analysis and was also witnessed and photographed by the first author. Almost seven decades of observation (Figs. 4 and 5) reveal a substantial loss of swamp rice fields (an annual net loss of -2.4%) and a regeneration of mangrove areas (an annual net gain of 0.8%), together with an increase in flooded land and mud (an annual net gain of 2.9%). Grasslands occupied only a small area during the whole period under study.
